metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5012 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 forLinux, Windows and Mac, and 56.0.2924.87 for Android, allowed a remoteattacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-browser-l10n - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-chromedriver - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
